titles: The secret lover. Or: The jealous father beguil'd. Loves passion is not easily kept under, nor faithful lovers to be kept asunder; because you know the proverb it is so, that love will creep, when as it cannot go. To a west-countrey [sic] tune; or, Alack for my love I must dye.
publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, at the Golden-ball near the Hospital-gate, in West-Smithfield.
notes: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
